name: mr_pete
text: A comment left by mr_pete was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by isunklower, greening_cow, rhymesforkids, unquotable, GitarooMan, Brosaurus)

name: joestork
text: I had to read that sentence three times to understand it, but yeah, totally.

name: dusty
text: I am agreeing with what I am saying by typing this right now because that sentence used far too many words to communicate what that sentence communicated to the point of causing nothing but confusion.

name: syrinx
text: Totally my favorite Achewood strip. I'm amazed at how much of Ray's and Pat's character can be portrayed in 6 panels.

name: andyk
text: A comment left by andyk was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by divot, mjfitzge, nighttoad, riotdejaneiro, alexhhhh, electricjelly, fancypants, NumberKillinger, clintisiceman, I_Love_Kate, STUART)

name: whuppins
text:
He's talking about running children over in his car.

Also, "Oh, proclaim on that pork loin!"

name: spinynorman
text: I really need to start proclaiming on a variety of meats. I really do.

name: hollis
text: Even Pat is dismayed at the mistaking of Heineken for wine.

name: fidget
text: I have had a bartender mistake Stella for wine.  And then I didn't even get to drink the wine.  And I had to pay for it and for the Stella. Bad News.

name: selbencoirlo
text: You didn't had to you paid for it because you are weak. Next time set the bartender on fire. They are soaked in alcohol. It is their weak point. You have your instructions.

name: quinlaenar
text: This was a decent post, maybe worth mentioning but not chubbying up until "It is their weak point." That just... Yes. Perfect wording.

name: mastronaut
text: I read it as the pink converse image being so disturbing as to even touch on pat's cold heart.

name: apocowarg
text: I think if that was the case you'd see Pat's reaction in the pink converse panel instead of in the next one. It would be fairly sloppy to delay a reaction during that much dialogue. Plus I don't think Pat would be too upset about them hitting a child, he'd probably blame the child for being near the road after dark.

name: soticoto
text: A comment left by soticoto was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by implode, heccibiggs, Doc_Rostov)

name: anzio
text: Yeah, seriously, what kind of asshole lets their kid run around near the road at night?

name: shirt145
text: Yes, I think Pat finally realizes the importance of this phone call, and will cease his interruptery.

name: carbonation
text: Funny, I read it as Pat being irritated and eventually appalled at Ray's dangerously hypocritical behavior.

name: soticoto
text: I'm inclined to think it isn't just the Heineken / wine thing, but that Pat isn't ever going to argue that someone is NOT dumb. To Pat everyone (but himself and the few famous people he likes) is dumb, and dumb people sicken him.

name: alejandroadam
text: I hate the ones where I agree with pat. it makes me feel like a dick.

name: saru
text:
You have to remember that Pat (alongside many, many other assholes) is on board with plenty of excellent concerns. There are good economical and ecological reasons behind veganism (I don't happen to agree with them, but that's neither here nor there). It does suck that gays can't rent cars in Alabama. And having a conversation while driving (or otherwise dividing your attention) is proven to be one of the leading causes of car accidents.
What I'm trying to say is that Pat is a dick.

name: numberkillinger
text: wait... gay people seriously can't rent a car in alabama? no way!

name: vance
text:
Yes, they can. The airport is pretty much the only damn place in Alabama where they have the titty mags anywhere but under several large piles of rock. As the point of entry, they're a little more cosmo than the rest of the state.

I exclude those extremely rural areas where there's so few people that the pretense of outrage has been dropped from the above statement, like where I went to college.

name: the_doz
text: He's right, though. Ray's car is not a God-Damned Phone Restaurant .

name: shutup_shutup
text: Pat is most agreeable when Ray is being an idiot.

name: fattybeaver
text: Change the pat to dan in panel 5 and this is exactly what my boss told me after he picked me up from a DUI

name: sexualhomeboy
text:
Your boss effing ROCKS!
Wait, he didn't fire you after the lecture, right?

name: cheeks_jd
text: Does this mean Tina was dumb?

name: relaxing
text: She was smart enough to kick Ray out.

name: ssddr
text: I think this is the only time ray has had sucess in stopping pat's dickery.

name: closefriend
text:
This happened to me once, except that I got to be the driver, I didn't know where I was going, and "Ray" was the passenger who did, but wouldn't get off the cellphone.

He was telling a story on the phone about a time he was in the Army and he had sex on base with his (female) commanding officer. I kept asking which exit I take and then he said, "Wait, wait, wait... I CAME IN HER ASS!!!"

We missed the exit. It was all my fault.

name: arbys
text:
I heard a guy on a cellphone having that kind of conversation once.

Even talking like that baffles me, but doing it on a cellphone in public (and I think this was actually in a public restroom, which made it worse) is just beyond the pail.

name: nikopol
text: "A family is changed forever" has totally entered my day-to-day conversations as a result of this strip.

name: imbeta
text:
you HAVE to say "Accidents" [period] "Crashes" [period] - "A family..."

that cracked me up.

name: dallovich
text: Only Ray can make you feel guilty about harrasing him for talking on the phone while driving.

name: godfatherofsouls
text: Turning gay gives you more facial features.

name: saru
text: Happened to my best friend, no shittin'.

name: xiaomimi
text: O God, that I were a man! I would make such jokes about giving gay men facial features.

name: justa
text: Love this. Anyone being an asshole to Pat is comedy gold in my book, but Ray being an asshole to Pat is comedy platinum .

name: farqussus
text: My girlfriend is Ray. So angry. Feel you Pat. Just this once.

name: gmm
text: "A famly is changed forever". 5.

name: henrythecad
text: The police walk up the mother's driveway! I'm serious!

name: melloclello
text: What makes this strip for me is that while it could have ended with a snappy punchline in panel 3, or even in panel 5, it [i]didn't[/]. Which is what sets Achewood apart from the rest.

name: trumbot
text:
A lesser strip would have stopped after the 3rd panel and newspaper readers everywhere would have been satiated.

This is not a lesser strip.

name: nyl
text: Wow, I actually feel sorry for Pat in this one- that's a weird feeling.

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
panel five is why this is a five.

i say this line all the time, in and out of context.

people do not get me.

name: fermatprime
text: Nutmeg! That's the secret ingredient in Coma! God, is that obvious!

name: joestork
text: Bubble-butt bartender power is untraceable power.

name: duperando
text: I love this more than words can describe.

name: srmeowmeow
text:
I felt I had to revisit this strip to say:

This is wordy Achewood at its best. It is on the knife edge of being pretentious and bloated, but pulls it off. I think it's because Pat is the perfect foil for this conversation. Either way, a great strip.

name: srmeowmeow
text: Wait - I think I've got it. The reason this works and, say, the more recent strips where Ray just sort of weirdly declaims about something is that Pat's presence and reactions make it clear that Ray is being dumb here. I much prefer the Ray who can banter with and tease Pat to the one who sits at his desk leaning back in his huge chair announcing his philosophy of life.

name: tfaironpirate
text:
Okay, someone needs to help me out here. Is it just me or is Pat nicer now? I mean. Yes, a dick be him, but he still seems to be a bit more stand-able. I mean maybe it's just that he has some back story now. Or that he's Gay and that relates him to a thing people I know are, well, a thing people I know are that isn't unpleasant (I KNOW WHAT I DID VEGANS!).

Actually, on second thought I think it's just he seems to be spending a lot more time with Ray. Less distant and all that, he's definitely no longer at the point of trying to shoot a man for a single insult. Also, I guess it aslo has to do with that people shouldn't talk on the phone while driving, f'reals.

name: hendetta
text: Come on Pat. Marital problems. Alcoholism. Couples are torn apart.
